quest.name: Search and Seizure
journal: Kikipu is searching for someone to help her with the land prospectors who have their sights set on the Silver Bazaar.

You witness a confrontation between Kikipu and Kenrick in which the future of the Silver Bazaar is threatened once more. After the heated discussion, you learn that Kenrick's thugs have placed writs of seizure all about the Bazaar. Locate the writs and remove them, making sure to take care of any fiends who appear to stop you.

You have taken down all of the writs of seizure and put an end to Kenrick's henchmen. Take the writs to the Silver Bazaar gate, where Kenrick is awaiting his demolitionists, and return them to him with grand indignation.
You have returned the writs of seizure to Kenrick, who flees in terror after learning that you have bested his henchmen. Go and speak with Kikipu about all that has transpired.

Kikipu thanks you in her own awkward way for saving her and the Silver Bazaar from ruin. Moved by the love she bears her humble home, you observe at least two more of the Bazaar's inhabitants resolve to stand with her. Deliver the letter Kikipu has given you to Momodi at the Quicksand in Ul'dah.
You have given Kikipu's letter to Momodi, and learned that the two are old, close friends. With Kikipu around to stand watch, the Silver Bazaar will be safe from harm for a good while.
objectives: Tear down the writs of seizure.
Deliver Kikipu's letter to Momodi at the Quicksand.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: It's terrible, Forename! Simply terrible! Please, you must help us. You've already done so much for us, I know, but we are in grave danger!

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: Those fiends have drawn up a fake contract of sale and are trying to use it to drive us from the Bazaar!

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: Do you smell that, Kikipu? That is the smell of inevitability. You knew this day would come. You simply chose to fill the interim with resistance rather than acceptance. Brave, but foolish.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: Back for more, Kenrick? How many times must I say it before it seeps into that thick skull of yours? I'll die before I see one ilm of this land fall into your hands!

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: Easily arranged, I assure you. Come, Kikipu, listen to reason. You know who we are. You know our deeds. You've no hope in this.

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: Look at this miserable place. A stain on the map. You resist now, but I swear I will lay waste to these shabby tents and broken buildings. And when I'm finished, I guarantee you will thank me for it.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: You stupid, foolish man. You couldn't be more wrong.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: We may no longer boast the visitors or gil of days past, but this is home to me and many more. Our memories are here─years' worth of them. Decades.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: We sweated together when we dug this well. We laughed and drank together in every festival. And we mourned together with each life the desert took from us.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: That is the Silver Bazaar. That is home. Those memories are what make this place. And I swear to the Twelve above, I'll feed you and whatever masters you serve your own manhood before I let you destroy it!

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: <sigh> Stubborn girl... No matter. The sale is all but concluded. Look about you. Writs of seizure have already been posted.

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: And I'd not think of taking them down, were I you. End this futile fight, Kikipu! There are far more of us, and if you are truly willing to die for this place, we're more than willing to oblige you.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: Forename, please, the writs of seizure! You must tear them down and chase Kenrick from here once and for all!

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: I thought you might be along. Pity, you're too late. The demolitionists are already on their way. Every building bearing a writ of seizure will be rubble within the hour!

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: ...Th-The writs! You... What have you done!?

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: But that means... My men... No, that's impossible.

dialogue.name: KENRICK
dialogue.text: The day may be yours, but I will be back soon, and with far more fearsome company. You've made an enemy for life, you fool. I won't be content simply to see the Bazaar struck from the maps. No, I will not rest until its name is wiped from every history book in Eorzea!

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: So, Kenrick is gone for now, is he? That's certainly the brightest news we've had in a while, though I can't help but wonder about the “more fearsome company” he threatens to bring.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: Uh... I-I've never had a way with words... Bloody paltry things. But I, er...we would like to thank you, Forename. You've not just saved the Silver Bazaar. You've saved me. You've saved who I am.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: I see now that I'll have to maintain constant vigilance to keep my home from harm. But it's a vigil I welcome. I'll stand up to any threat that comes through that gate.

dialogue.name: FAFAFONO
dialogue.text: And we'll stand with you!

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: Wh-What do you...?

dialogue.name: GALFRIDUS
dialogue.text: Saw what ye did for us, havin' Forename here chase off Kenrick an' all. It's true, there ain't much here worth fightin' for. But it's home, godsdammit, an' I for one ain't ready to give up on it just yet.

dialogue.name: FAFAFONO
dialogue.text: Aye, this is home. And even if there's nothing left but sand and cracked stone, then I say we build something─right here, together.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: Thank you, everyone... Thank you so much. And most of all, thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: There are no more fine garments of goldspun and brocade here. No more bustling port with ships full of cargo and fish. But the better days live on in our hearts. We are the Silver Bazaar, and it is us. Our memories, our past, our history─that is what makes this place.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: So long as we remain, so too does hope. You taught us what it is to defend the home we love, and from now on, we'll do no less for ourselves than you've done for us.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: I've a final favor to ask of you. This letter...I wonder if you would deliver it to Momodi for me when next you visit Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: KIKIPU
dialogue.text: She and I have been friends for many years. Let her read my words, and she'll be able to give you the reward I cannot.

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: What's all this, then? You got somethin' for me?

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: Hm? A letter? Now who would think to─

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: Kikipu! Haven't had word from that ol' gal in ages. How's the dear doin'? Let's see here... Mmm-hmmm... Uh-huh... Hahaha! That's Kikipu, all right.

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: Time was I used to call in at the Silver Bazaar quite often. This was back when it was still the busiest hub in Thanalan, mind you. Ol' Kikipu and I used to stay up till dawn talkin' 'bout...well, whatever girls do.

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: Kikipu's the very heart and soul of that place. Hells, even most folk here in the city still remember her name.

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: Breaks my bloody heart to hear her and them good folk were nearly forced from their land. Dirty business, that.

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: But I'm not to the point of worryin' just yet. I'd wager gil to goobbue poop the Silver Bazaar'll be rallyin' back to its former glory 'fore long.

dialogue.name: MOODI
dialogue.text: In any case, I thank the Twelve you were there to help them. Here, for you─on behalf of Kikipu and the Bazaar.

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!
